intro: Euphrasia minima var. pallida, commonly known as the pale tailed eyebright, is a small flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its delicate, pale yellow flowers and hairy, glandular leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with similar morphological traits. Its flowers bloom in early spring and are often visited by bees and other pollinators.
